activities: Personal data received in the course of Mars' business activities that include:  (1) consumer personal data such as that received: providing various consumer services; administering contests and promotions; offering product registration and support; enabling sales and other transactions; conducting data analysis to improve products and services; and/or maintaining advertising or marketing relationships; and (2) Human resources data.  The personal data received by Mars Incorporated or any of its US based subsidiary companies from the EU includes both personal data that Mars processes as a data controller (i.e., Mars alone or jointly with others determines the purposes and means of the processing of the personal data) and personal data that Mars processes as a data processor on behalf of data controllers.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Personal data processed off-line, on-line, and manually
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
